results.title: Germination and growth of a plant
results.brief_description:
Use of time-lapse photography showing the growth of a lupin plant. Shows the root growth below the ground, how the flower is pollinated by the bees and the internal germination is carried out - the production of the seed pod and finally the dispersal of the seeds.
Title and credits missing from film.

results.title: George Melies cinema magician
results.creator_credit: Luciano Martinengo, Patrick Montgomery and Blackhawk Films
results.brief_description: Cinema’s first genius, Georges Melies, was a professional magician who quickly realised that the camera offered the best illusion machine in the world. Renowned for his trick films, he was actually the first to tell complete stories on film and the first to use the camera effects considered standard today
results.creator_credit_for_label: Luciano Martinengo, Patrick Montgomery and Blackhawk Films

results.title: Geelong
results.creator_credit: John Porter and Eric Porter Productions
results.brief_description: On the shores of Corio Bay, 45 miles from Melbourne, the great factories of Geelong beat out a productive rhythm. People flock to the beach resorts of Torquay, Anglesea and Lorne; from Australian Rules to the Great Ocean Road, this film acts as a brochure to Victoria’s second largest city.

results.title: Gardens of Japan
results.brief_description: Some of the scenic beauty of Japan - in nature and in the highly cultivated and famous gardens in Tokyo and Kyoto; a variety of gardens which have been planned and cultivated to please both the mind and the eye, including those using sand and stone to represent natural landscapes and which have symbolic signifance. A short sequence shows the traditional tea ceremony. A revised version of Title Codes 004193 and 004194.

results.title: Gallipoli: a virtual tour (MAC & PC)
results.brief_description: A highly visual interactive document on the First World War Gallipoli campaign. Containing hundreds of images, documents, music and various footage from 1915 makes this virtual tour ideal for schools. This CD-ROM is broken up into various historical aspects and is set up to play on both PC and Mac computers - all you need is a web browser such as Internet Explorer or Netscape. For PC users, Internet Explorer 5 can be installed from the CD.

results.title: Gala presentation and crowning of Miss Australia 1970
results.brief_description: A record of the Miss Australia Charity Quest of 1970 held in Adelaide. The state finalists are presented and interviewed before the crowning of Rhonda Ifland from NSW assisted by Miss Australia 1969, Susan McCellard. Hosted by Maggie Tabberer and Geoff McComas. Guests include: South Australian premier Steel Hall; and Bernard Dowd representing Hickory, the event sponsors. Hickory commercials are interspersed throughout the film.

results.title: Furnace practice
results.creator_credit: George Wynn and CWS Film Unit
results.brief_description: A fuel economy film, for furnace men and plant managers, dealing with furnaces of all kinds - using coal, pitch, gas, oil or electricity. The ain is to get the heat and transmit it with the minimum loss. The chief subjects touched are firing methods, use of mechanical stokers; proper control of air supply; importance of cleanliness; repairs, maintenance, and improvements; recovery of hear from chimneys; need for careful records as a check on running economy.

results.title: Funny Felix = Drole de felix [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Jacques Martineau, Olivier Ducastel, Phillipe Martinez, Les Films Pelleas and Peccadillo Pictures
results.brief_description: Felix (Sami Bouajila) is an Arab French man who, on finding himself unemployed at his job on the wharfs of Callais, decides to undertake a five day hitchhiking journey to find his estranged father in Marseilles. Organizing for his boyfriend to meet him at the end of the week, Felix takes up his backpack and begins a road trip which becomes an investigation of not only contemporary France, but also a deeply human exploration of the meaning of family. Whilst he confronts bigotry and violence on the way, he also engages in fleeting but emotionally rich encounters with women and men who become a surrogate brother, grandmother, cousin, sister and father for him. ‘Funny Felix’ is one of the best examples of the new humanist French cinema that has developed in the late 1990s. Though acknowledging the social divisions and fissures of contemporary Europe, films such as ‘Funny Felix’ are committed to celebrating and detailing the diverse experiences of modern working class lives. In contrast to English-language gay themes films, “Funny Felix” is free of moralism and segregated identities. Felix, whose positive HIV-status is treated with compassion, but also with blithe acceptance, is expertly played by Bouajila. The cast includes Ariane Ascardie and Patachou. In French with with English subtitles.

results.title: Fundamentals of carrier telephony. Pt 1.  Principles and applications
results.brief_description: Explains the use of carrier telephoning to increase the number of telephone channels on a single wire without the extra cost of wires etc. Using diagrams it shows how four voices can use the same wires without interference to each user.
